componentAttributes.richTextValue:
Community Guidelines 

 

The Community at Illumina is comprised of real people who exchange ideas, solutions, tips, techniques, and information about Illumina products and services. We strive to create a friendly and collaborative environment, and we're glad that you'll be joining us! Note that your use of these Community Forums is subject to the following guidelines and the Illumina Terms of Use.

 

Be friendly. We want everyone to have a positive experience in the Illumina Community Forums. Please keep your interactions with other community members polite and respectful. Your opinions are always welcome, but personal insults and harassment in either the Community Forums or through private messaging is unacceptable. Specifically, please refrain from posting anything unlawful, obscene, abusive, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable to third parties. Please donâ€™t post content that would constitute advertising, spam, or any other form of unauthorized solicitation.

 

Keep it productive. The Forums are designed to provide a place for customers to seek and receive help from other community members, so please keep your comments constructive and relevant to the topic on the forum or thread. To get help directly from Illumina, please contact our support team. Solicitation of Illumina Community members for research or sales purposes, and commentary pertaining to litigation involving Illumina or discussing proprietary information is prohibited.

 

Share with others. Add value to the community by sharing your knowledge and experience. You may have the missing piece of knowledge to help a fellow community member solve their burning question. These interactions are the lifeblood of the Illumina community.

 

Be responsible. You are solely responsible for your interactions with other Forum users. Exercise common sense and your best judgment when interacting with others, including when you submit comments or post any personal information regarding yourself or others. In addition to protecting the privacy of yourself and others, please respect copyright, fair use, intellectual property, and other applicable laws. Reference and cite sources appropriately, and do not publish pictures or other materials from another person without their consent.

 

Use good network etiquette. We ask that all users follow a few common standards when posting to the Forums. Please refrain from typing in all capital letters, enlarging text for emphasis, or using numerous exclamation points. Likewise, please do not multipost, cross-post, or otherwise spam the Forums. Other members will appreciate your effort to keep the Forums readable.

 

Weâ€™re here to help. If you are new to the community and are unsure about anything, please just ask! Moderators, Illumina employees (identified by the Illumina "employee" in brackets next to the user name), and other participants are always happy to answer questions or offer assistance.


If you recognize any violation of these guidelines or the Terms of Use, please notify us within the community by choosing "Report Inappropriate Content" from the message's Options dropdown menu and let us know why you feel the content is inappropriate. If you ever have any questions about these guidelines or anything else pertaining to this community, feel free to drop us a line: TheCommunity@Illumina.com 


Illumina retains the right, but not the responsibility, to edit or remove any Submission, including those deemed by the company to violate these guidelines or the Terms of Service. Illumina will make good faith efforts to investigate allegations that Submissions violate these guidelines or the Terms of Service but (a) makes no warranty to you that it will edit, remove, or continue to permit the display of any specific Submission, whether or not subject to such allegations, and (b) will have no liability whatsoever for editing, removing, or continuing to permit the display of any Submission whatsoever. Moderators can remove anyone at any time for violating these guidelines, or for any other reason.
